intro: Cathormion multiflorum, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Colchicaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain toxic seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or dry habitats. Due to its toxicity, it is important to handle the plant with care.
